content: 1 *kfb k to 1 st before marker kfb sm repeat from * 3 more times round 2 *k until the end of the round sm as you come to them repeat rounds 1 & 2 3 more times for a total of 8 rounds 32 sts increased slip_stitch section knit with cc round 1 *kfb sl1pwyib k1 repeat between until 1 st before marker kfb sm repeat from * until the end of round 8 sts increased round 2 *k2 sl1pwyib p1 repeat between until 2 sts before marker k2 sm repeat from * until the end of round repeat the stockinette and slip_stitch sections 30 more times for a total of 31 times then work the slip_stitch section 1 more time picot border with mc bobble all stitches using the picot method below and remove stitch markers as you come to them *cable co 3 sts bobble off 12 sts using k2tog tbl and slipping the bound off stitch back to the left-hand needle each time repeat until all stitches are bound off note when getting close to the corner edges it is suggested that you bind off less sts on your last picot before the marker this allows you to begin the cable cast on immediately after the marker which will create a picot at the corner to have a mirrored effect repeat the same number of bound off stitches on that first picot after the marker finishing sew in ends and block according to dimensions © sonder yarn co 2023 | www sonderyarnco com | for personal use only le square | page 3 alternate co directions for starting flat if you prefer to begin by working flat follow the instructions below this alternative method allows you to start knitting flat and when you feel comfortable you can switch to either dpns or circular needles and continue the pattern we suggest that you switch at the beginning of a stockinette section notes when you decide to switch to working in the round add a bor marker and join to knit in the round being careful not to twist your stitches and make sure that you are knitting in the proper direction with the stockinette fabric facing outward you will also need to seam the section that was knit flat using the mattress stitch but that can wait until the end once you begin knitting in the round please refer to the directions for knitting in the round please be sure to read all the notes at the beginning of the pattern with mc co 8 sts prep row row 1 rs k2 pm k2 pm k2 pm k2 row 2 ws pfb every st 16 sts main body stockinette section knit with mc row 1 rs *kfb
